channel.title: Migrating existing install to RAID 1
channel.description:
Be warned, it's nothing short of a HUGE pain in the ass.
I basically followed a combination of these walkthroughs: http://linuxconfig.org/Linux_Software_Raid_1_Setup http://www.debian-administration.org/articles/238 http://www.howtoforge.com/software-raid1-grub-boot-debian-etch-p3
And it's currently syncing up right now, so I suppose it turned out good. I need to tweak grub a little when the syncing finishes, but otherwise, I'm done. Now in the future when a hard drive goes bad the only downtime we should have is turning the server off to physically swap out the drives. Of course I will still backup everything every 7 days and store the files offsite as well, as RAID isn't a replacement for backups.

item.title: Migrating existing install to RAID 1
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

RAID 1 is plenty for our/my needs. I’m not even sure the case would hold more than 2 hard drives. First of all I back up EVERYTHING every 7 days automatically (to multiple locations, including my home server), and secondly if one of these drives messes up mdadm will shoot me an email letting me know, I’ll have to run one command, shut down the server, swap drives, and run one more command when it comes back up. We won’t lose anything besides maybe 30 minutes while the drive is being swapped.
